intro: Ixeridium dentatum subsp. dentatum, commonly known as the serrated pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny heads of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a rosette of narrow, serrated leaves. It produces small, white to yellow florets arranged in a compact, cushion-like structure. Ixeridium dentatum subsp. dentatum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought-resistant properties.
